33/**
34 * DOC: Logical Rings, Logical Ring Contexts and Execlists
35 *
36 * Motivation:
37 * GEN8 brings an expansion of the HW contexts: "Logical Ring Contexts".
38 * These expanded contexts enable a number of new abilities, especially
39 * "Execlists" (also implemented in this file).
40 *
41 * One of the main differences with the legacy HW contexts is that logical
42 * ring contexts incorporate many more things to the context's state, like
43 * PDPs or ringbuffer control registers:
44 *
45 * The reason why PDPs are included in the context is straightforward: as
46 * PPGTTs (per-process GTTs) are actually per-context, having the PDPs
47 * contained there mean you don't need to do a ppgtt->switch_mm yourself,
48 * instead, the GPU will do it for you on the context switch.
49 *
50 * But, what about the ringbuffer control registers (head, tail, etc..)?
51 * shouldn't we just need a set of those per engine command streamer? This is
52 * where the name "Logical Rings" starts to make sense: by virtualizing the
53 * rings, the engine cs shifts to a new "ring buffer" with every context
54 * switch. When you want to submit a workload to the GPU you: A) choose your
55 * context, B) find its appropriate virtualized ring, C) write commands to it
56 * and then, finally, D) tell the GPU to switch to that context.
57 *
58 * Instead of the legacy MI_SET_CONTEXT, the way you tell the GPU to switch
59 * to a contexts is via a context execution list, ergo "Execlists".
60 *
61 * LRC implementation:
62 * Regarding the creation of contexts, we have:
63 *
64 * - One global default context.
65 * - One local default context for each opened fd.
66 * - One local extra context for each context create ioctl call.
67 *
68 * Now that ringbuffers belong per-context (and not per-engine, like before)
69 * and that contexts are uniquely tied to a given engine (and not reusable,
70 * like before) we need:
71 *
72 * - One ringbuffer per-engine inside each context.
73 * - One backing object per-engine inside each context.
74 *
75 * The global default context starts its life with these new objects fully
76 * allocated and populated. The local default context for each opened fd is
77 * more complex, because we don't know at creation time which engine is going
78 * to use them. To handle this, we have implemented a deferred creation of LR
79 * contexts:
80 *
81 * The local context starts its life as a hollow or blank holder, that only
82 * gets populated for a given engine once we receive an execbuffer. If later
83 * on we receive another execbuffer ioctl for the same context but a different
84 * engine, we allocate/populate a new ringbuffer and context backing object and
85 * so on.
86 *
87 * Finally, regarding local contexts created using the ioctl call: as they are
88 * only allowed with the render ring, we can allocate & populate them right
89 * away (no need to defer anything, at least for now).
90 *
91 * Execlists implementation:
92 * Execlists are the new method by which, on gen8+ hardware, workloads are
93 * submitted for execution (as opposed to the legacy, ringbuffer-based, method).
94 * This method works as follows:
95 *
96 * When a request is committed, its commands (the BB start and any leading or
97 * trailing commands, like the seqno breadcrumbs) are placed in the ringbuffer
98 * for the appropriate context. The tail pointer in the hardware context is not
99 * updated at this time, but instead, kept by the driver in the ringbuffer
100 * structure. A structure representing this request is added to a request queue
101 * for the appropriate engine: this structure contains a copy of the context's
102 * tail after the request was written to the ring buffer and a pointer to the
103 * context itself.
104 *
105 * If the engine's request queue was empty before the request was added, the
106 * queue is processed immediately. Otherwise the queue will be processed during
107 * a context switch interrupt. In any case, elements on the queue will get sent
108 * (in pairs) to the GPU's ExecLists Submit Port (ELSP, for short) with a
109 * globally unique 20-bits submission ID.
110 *
111 * When execution of a request completes, the GPU updates the context status
112 * buffer with a context complete event and generates a context switch interrupt.
113 * During the interrupt handling, the driver examines the events in the buffer:
114 * for each context complete event, if the announced ID matches that on the head
115 * of the request queue, then that request is retired and removed from the queue.
116 *
117 * After processing, if any requests were retired and the queue is not empty
118 * then a new execution list can be submitted. The two requests at the front of
119 * the queue are next to be submitted but since a context may not occur twice in
120 * an execution list, if subsequent requests have the same ID as the first then
121 * the two requests must be combined. This is done simply by discarding requests
122 * at the head of the queue until either only one requests is left (in which case
123 * we use a NULL second context) or the first two requests have unique IDs.
124 *
125 * By always executing the first two requests in the queue the driver ensures
126 * that the GPU is kept as busy as possible. In the case where a single context
127 * completes but a second context is still executing, the request for this second
128 * context will be at the head of the queue when we remove the first one. This
129 * request will then be resubmitted along with a new request for a different context,
130 * which will cause the hardware to continue executing the second request and queue
131 * the new request (the GPU detects the condition of a context getting preempted
132 * with the same context and optimizes the context switch flow by not doing
133 * preemption, but just sampling the new tail pointer).
134 *
135 */
136

147#define GEN9_LR_CONTEXT_RENDER_SIZE (22 * PAGE_SIZE)
148#define GEN8_LR_CONTEXT_RENDER_SIZE (20 * PAGE_SIZE)
149#define GEN8_LR_CONTEXT_OTHER_SIZE (2 * PAGE_SIZE)
150
151#define RING_EXECLIST_QFULL (1 << 0x2)
152#define RING_EXECLIST1_VALID (1 << 0x3)
153#define RING_EXECLIST0_VALID (1 << 0x4)
154#define RING_EXECLIST_ACTIVE_STATUS (3 << 0xE)
155#define RING_EXECLIST1_ACTIVE (1 << 0x11)
156#define RING_EXECLIST0_ACTIVE (1 << 0x12)
157
158#define GEN8_CTX_STATUS_IDLE_ACTIVE (1 << 0)
159#define GEN8_CTX_STATUS_PREEMPTED (1 << 1)
160#define GEN8_CTX_STATUS_ELEMENT_SWITCH (1 << 2)
161#define GEN8_CTX_STATUS_ACTIVE_IDLE (1 << 3)
162#define GEN8_CTX_STATUS_COMPLETE (1 << 4)
163#define GEN8_CTX_STATUS_LITE_RESTORE (1 << 15)
164
165#define CTX_LRI_HEADER_0 0x01
166#define CTX_CONTEXT_CONTROL 0x02
167#define CTX_RING_HEAD 0x04
168#define CTX_RING_TAIL 0x06
169#define CTX_RING_BUFFER_START 0x08
170#define CTX_RING_BUFFER_CONTROL 0x0a
171#define CTX_BB_HEAD_U 0x0c
172#define CTX_BB_HEAD_L 0x0e
173#define CTX_BB_STATE 0x10
174#define CTX_SECOND_BB_HEAD_U 0x12
175#define CTX_SECOND_BB_HEAD_L 0x14
176#define CTX_SECOND_BB_STATE 0x16
177#define CTX_BB_PER_CTX_PTR 0x18
178#define CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX 0x1a
179#define CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX_OFFSET 0x1c
180#define CTX_LRI_HEADER_1 0x21
181#define CTX_CTX_TIMESTAMP 0x22
182#define CTX_PDP3_UDW 0x24
183#define CTX_PDP3_LDW 0x26
184#define CTX_PDP2_UDW 0x28
185#define CTX_PDP2_LDW 0x2a
186#define CTX_PDP1_UDW 0x2c
187#define CTX_PDP1_LDW 0x2e
188#define CTX_PDP0_UDW 0x30
189#define CTX_PDP0_LDW 0x32
190#define CTX_LRI_HEADER_2 0x41
191#define CTX_R_PWR_CLK_STATE 0x42
192#define CTX_GPGPU_CSR_BASE_ADDRESS 0x44
193
194#define GEN8_CTX_VALID (1<<0)
195#define GEN8_CTX_FORCE_PD_RESTORE (1<<1)
196#define GEN8_CTX_FORCE_RESTORE (1<<2)
197#define GEN8_CTX_L3LLC_COHERENT (1<<5)
198#define GEN8_CTX_PRIVILEGE (1<<8)
199
200#define ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, n) { \
201 const u64 _addr = i915_page_dir_dma_addr((ppgtt), (n)); \
202 reg_state[CTX_PDP ## n ## _UDW+1] = upper_32_bits(_addr); \
203 reg_state[CTX_PDP ## n ## _LDW+1] = lower_32_bits(_addr); \
204}
205
206#define ASSIGN_CTX_PML4(ppgtt, reg_state) { \
207 reg_state[CTX_PDP0_UDW + 1] = upper_32_bits(px_dma(&ppgtt->pml4)); \
208 reg_state[CTX_PDP0_LDW + 1] = lower_32_bits(px_dma(&ppgtt->pml4)); \
209}
210
211enum {
212 ADVANCED_CONTEXT = 0,
213 LEGACY_32B_CONTEXT,
214 ADVANCED_AD_CONTEXT,
215 LEGACY_64B_CONTEXT
216};
217#define GEN8_CTX_ADDRESSING_MODE_SHIFT 3
218#define GEN8_CTX_ADDRESSING_MODE(dev) (USES_FULL_48BIT_PPGTT(dev) ?\
219 LEGACY_64B_CONTEXT :\
220 LEGACY_32B_CONTEXT)
221enum {
222 FAULT_AND_HANG = 0,
223 FAULT_AND_HALT, /* Debug only */
224 FAULT_AND_STREAM,
225 FAULT_AND_CONTINUE /* Unsupported */
226};
227#define GEN8_CTX_ID_SHIFT 32
228#define CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX_OFFSET_DEFAULT 0x17
229
230static int intel_lr_context_pin(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq);
231static void lrc_setup_hardware_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
232 struct drm_i915_gem_object *default_ctx_obj);

234
235/**
236 * intel_sanitize_enable_execlists() - sanitize i915.enable_execlists
237 * @dev: DRM device.
238 * @enable_execlists: value of i915.enable_execlists module parameter.
239 *
240 * Only certain platforms support Execlists (the prerequisites being
241 * support for Logical Ring Contexts and Aliasing PPGTT or better).
242 *
243 * Return: 1 if Execlists is supported and has to be enabled.
244 */
245int intel_sanitize_enable_execlists(struct drm_device *dev, int enable_execlists)
246{
247 WARN_ON(i915.enable_ppgtt == -1);
248
249 /* On platforms with execlist available, vGPU will only
250 * support execlist mode, no ring buffer mode.
251 */
252 if (HAS_LOGICAL_RING_CONTEXTS(dev) && intel_vgpu_active(dev))
253 return 1;
254
255 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9)
256 return 1;
257
258 if (enable_execlists == 0)
259 return 0;
260
261 if (HAS_LOGICAL_RING_CONTEXTS(dev) && USES_PPGTT(dev) &&
262 i915.use_mmio_flip >= 0)
263 return 1;
264
265 return 0;
266}
267
268/**
269 * intel_execlists_ctx_id() - get the Execlists Context ID
270 * @ctx_obj: Logical Ring Context backing object.
271 *
272 * Do not confuse with ctx->id! Unfortunately we have a name overload
273 * here: the old context ID we pass to userspace as a handler so that
274 * they can refer to a context, and the new context ID we pass to the
275 * ELSP so that the GPU can inform us of the context status via
276 * interrupts.
277 *
278 * Return: 20-bits globally unique context ID.
279 */
280u32 intel_execlists_ctx_id(struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj)
281{
282 u32 lrca = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(ctx_obj) +
283 LRC_PPHWSP_PN * PAGE_SIZE;
284
285 /* LRCA is required to be 4K aligned so the more significant 20 bits
286 * are globally unique */
287 return lrca >> 12;
288}
289
290static bool disable_lite_restore_wa(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
291{
292 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
293
294 return ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_B0) ||
295 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0)) &&
296 (ring->id == VCS || ring->id == VCS2);
297}
298
299uint64_t intel_lr_context_descriptor(struct intel_context *ctx,
300 struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
301{
302 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj = ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
303 uint64_t desc;
304 uint64_t lrca = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(ctx_obj) +
305 LRC_PPHWSP_PN * PAGE_SIZE;
306
307 WARN_ON(lrca & 0xFFFFFFFF00000FFFULL);
308
309 desc = GEN8_CTX_VALID;
310 desc |= GEN8_CTX_ADDRESSING_MODE(dev) << GEN8_CTX_ADDRESSING_MODE_SHIFT;
311 if (IS_GEN8(ctx_obj->base.dev))
312 desc |= GEN8_CTX_L3LLC_COHERENT;
313 desc |= GEN8_CTX_PRIVILEGE;
314 desc |= lrca;
315 desc |= (u64)intel_execlists_ctx_id(ctx_obj) << GEN8_CTX_ID_SHIFT;
316
317 /* TODO: WaDisableLiteRestore when we start using semaphore
318 * signalling between Command Streamers */
319 /* desc |= GEN8_CTX_FORCE_RESTORE; */
320
321 /* WaEnableForceRestoreInCtxtDescForVCS:skl */
322 /* WaEnableForceRestoreInCtxtDescForVCS:bxt */
323 if (disable_lite_restore_wa(ring))
324 desc |= GEN8_CTX_FORCE_RESTORE;
325
326 return desc;
327}
328
329static void execlists_elsp_write(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq0,
330 struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq1)
331{
332
333 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = rq0->ring;
334 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
335 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
336 uint64_t desc[2];
337
338 if (rq1) {
339 desc[1] = intel_lr_context_descriptor(rq1->ctx, rq1->ring);
340 rq1->elsp_submitted++;
341 } else {
342 desc[1] = 0;
343 }
344
345 desc[0] = intel_lr_context_descriptor(rq0->ctx, rq0->ring);
346 rq0->elsp_submitted++;
347
348 /* You must always write both descriptors in the order below. */
349 spin_lock(&dev_priv->uncore.lock);
350 intel_uncore_forcewake_get__locked(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
351 I915_WRITE_FW(RING_ELSP(ring), upper_32_bits(desc[1]));
352 I915_WRITE_FW(RING_ELSP(ring), lower_32_bits(desc[1]));
353
354 I915_WRITE_FW(RING_ELSP(ring), upper_32_bits(desc[0]));
355 /* The context is automatically loaded after the following */
356 I915_WRITE_FW(RING_ELSP(ring), lower_32_bits(desc[0]));
357
358 /* ELSP is a wo register, use another nearby reg for posting */
359 POSTING_READ_FW(RING_EXECLIST_STATUS_LO(ring));
360 intel_uncore_forcewake_put__locked(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
361 spin_unlock(&dev_priv->uncore.lock);
362}
363
364static int execlists_update_context(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq)
365{
366 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = rq->ring;
367 struct i915_hw_ppgtt *ppgtt = rq->ctx->ppgtt;
368 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj = rq->ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
369 struct drm_i915_gem_object *rb_obj = rq->ringbuf->obj;
370 struct page *page;
371 uint32_t *reg_state;
372
373 BUG_ON(!ctx_obj);
374 WARN_ON(!i915_gem_obj_is_pinned(ctx_obj));
375 WARN_ON(!i915_gem_obj_is_pinned(rb_obj));
376
377 page = i915_gem_object_get_page(ctx_obj, LRC_STATE_PN);
378 reg_state = kmap_atomic(page);
379
380 reg_state[CTX_RING_TAIL+1] = rq->tail;
381 reg_state[CTX_RING_BUFFER_START+1] = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(rb_obj);
382
383 if (ppgtt && !USES_FULL_48BIT_PPGTT(ppgtt->base.dev)) {
384 /* True 32b PPGTT with dynamic page allocation: update PDP
385 * registers and point the unallocated PDPs to scratch page.
386 * PML4 is allocated during ppgtt init, so this is not needed
387 * in 48-bit mode.
388 */
389 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 3);
390 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 2);
391 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 1);
392 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 0);
393 }
394
395 kunmap_atomic(reg_state);
396
397 return 0;
398}
399
400static void execlists_submit_requests(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq0,
401 struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq1)
402{
403 execlists_update_context(rq0);
404
405 if (rq1)
406 execlists_update_context(rq1);
407
408 execlists_elsp_write(rq0, rq1);
409}
410
411static void execlists_context_unqueue(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
412{
413 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req0 = NULL, *req1 = NULL;
414 struct drm_i915_gem_request *cursor = NULL, *tmp = NULL;
415
416 assert_spin_locked(&ring->execlist_lock);
417
418 /*
419 * If irqs are not active generate a warning as batches that finish
420 * without the irqs may get lost and a GPU Hang may occur.
421 */
422 WARN_ON(!intel_irqs_enabled(ring->dev->dev_private));
423
424 if (list_empty(&ring->execlist_queue))
425 return;
426
427 /* Try to read in pairs */
428 list_for_each_entry_safe(cursor, tmp, &ring->execlist_queue,
429 execlist_link) {
430 if (!req0) {
431 req0 = cursor;
432 } else if (req0->ctx == cursor->ctx) {
433 /* Same ctx: ignore first request, as second request
434 * will update tail past first request's workload */
435 cursor->elsp_submitted = req0->elsp_submitted;
436 list_del(&req0->execlist_link);
437 list_add_tail(&req0->execlist_link,
438 &ring->execlist_retired_req_list);
439 req0 = cursor;
440 } else {
441 req1 = cursor;
442 break;
443 }
444 }
445
446 if (IS_GEN8(ring->dev) || IS_GEN9(ring->dev)) {
447 /*
448 * WaIdleLiteRestore: make sure we never cause a lite
449 * restore with HEAD==TAIL
450 */
451 if (req0->elsp_submitted) {
452 /*
453 * Apply the wa NOOPS to prevent ring:HEAD == req:TAIL
454 * as we resubmit the request. See gen8_emit_request()
455 * for where we prepare the padding after the end of the
456 * request.
457 */
458 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf;
459
460 ringbuf = req0->ctx->engine[ring->id].ringbuf;
461 req0->tail += 8;
462 req0->tail &= ringbuf->size - 1;
463 }
464 }
465
466 WARN_ON(req1 && req1->elsp_submitted);
467
468 execlists_submit_requests(req0, req1);
469}
470
471static bool execlists_check_remove_request(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
472 u32 request_id)
473{
474 struct drm_i915_gem_request *head_req;
475
476 assert_spin_locked(&ring->execlist_lock);
477
478 head_req = list_first_entry_or_null(&ring->execlist_queue,
479 struct drm_i915_gem_request,
480 execlist_link);
481
482 if (head_req != NULL) {
483 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj =
484 head_req->ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
485 if (intel_execlists_ctx_id(ctx_obj) == request_id) {
486 WARN(head_req->elsp_submitted == 0,
487 "Never submitted head request\n");
488
489 if (--head_req->elsp_submitted <= 0) {
490 list_del(&head_req->execlist_link);
491 list_add_tail(&head_req->execlist_link,
492 &ring->execlist_retired_req_list);
493 return true;
494 }
495 }
496 }
497
498 return false;
499}
500
501/**
502 * intel_lrc_irq_handler() - handle Context Switch interrupts
503 * @ring: Engine Command Streamer to handle.
504 *
505 * Check the unread Context Status Buffers and manage the submission of new
506 * contexts to the ELSP accordingly.
507 */
508void intel_lrc_irq_handler(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
509{
510 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
511 u32 status_pointer;
512 u8 read_pointer;
513 u8 write_pointer;
514 u32 status = 0;
515 u32 status_id;
516 u32 submit_contexts = 0;
517
518 status_pointer = I915_READ(RING_CONTEXT_STATUS_PTR(ring));
519
520 read_pointer = ring->next_context_status_buffer;
521 write_pointer = status_pointer & GEN8_CSB_PTR_MASK;
522 if (read_pointer > write_pointer)
523 write_pointer += GEN8_CSB_ENTRIES;
524
525 spin_lock(&ring->execlist_lock);
526
527 while (read_pointer < write_pointer) {
528 read_pointer++;
529 status = I915_READ(RING_CONTEXT_STATUS_BUF_LO(ring, read_pointer % GEN8_CSB_ENTRIES));
530 status_id = I915_READ(RING_CONTEXT_STATUS_BUF_HI(ring, read_pointer % GEN8_CSB_ENTRIES));
531
532 if (status & GEN8_CTX_STATUS_IDLE_ACTIVE)
533 continue;
534
535 if (status & GEN8_CTX_STATUS_PREEMPTED) {
536 if (status & GEN8_CTX_STATUS_LITE_RESTORE) {
537 if (execlists_check_remove_request(ring, status_id))
538 WARN(1, "Lite Restored request removed from queue\n");
539 } else
540 WARN(1, "Preemption without Lite Restore\n");
541 }
542
543 if ((status & GEN8_CTX_STATUS_ACTIVE_IDLE) ||
544 (status & GEN8_CTX_STATUS_ELEMENT_SWITCH)) {
545 if (execlists_check_remove_request(ring, status_id))
546 submit_contexts++;
547 }
548 }
549
550 if (disable_lite_restore_wa(ring)) {
551 /* Prevent a ctx to preempt itself */
552 if ((status & GEN8_CTX_STATUS_ACTIVE_IDLE) &&
553 (submit_contexts != 0))
554 execlists_context_unqueue(ring);
555 } else if (submit_contexts != 0) {
556 execlists_context_unqueue(ring);
557 }
558
559 spin_unlock(&ring->execlist_lock);
560
561 WARN(submit_contexts > 2, "More than two context complete events?\n");
562 ring->next_context_status_buffer = write_pointer % GEN8_CSB_ENTRIES;
563
564 I915_WRITE(RING_CONTEXT_STATUS_PTR(ring),
565 _MASKED_FIELD(GEN8_CSB_PTR_MASK << 8,
566 ((u32)ring->next_context_status_buffer &
567 GEN8_CSB_PTR_MASK) << 8));
568}
569
570static int execlists_context_queue(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
571{
572 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = request->ring;
573 struct drm_i915_gem_request *cursor;
574 int num_elements = 0;
575
576 if (request->ctx != ring->default_context)
577 intel_lr_context_pin(request);
578
579 i915_gem_request_reference(request);
580
581 spin_lock_irq(&ring->execlist_lock);
582
583 list_for_each_entry(cursor, &ring->execlist_queue, execlist_link)
584 if (++num_elements > 2)
585 break;
586
587 if (num_elements > 2) {
588 struct drm_i915_gem_request *tail_req;
589
590 tail_req = list_last_entry(&ring->execlist_queue,
591 struct drm_i915_gem_request,
592 execlist_link);
593
594 if (request->ctx == tail_req->ctx) {
595 WARN(tail_req->elsp_submitted != 0,
596 "More than 2 already-submitted reqs queued\n");
597 list_del(&tail_req->execlist_link);
598 list_add_tail(&tail_req->execlist_link,
599 &ring->execlist_retired_req_list);
600 }
601 }
602
603 list_add_tail(&request->execlist_link, &ring->execlist_queue);
604 if (num_elements == 0)
605 execlists_context_unqueue(ring);
606
607 spin_unlock_irq(&ring->execlist_lock);
608
609 return 0;
610}
611
612static int logical_ring_invalidate_all_caches(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
613{
614 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
615 uint32_t flush_domains;
616 int ret;
617
618 flush_domains = 0;
619 if (ring->gpu_caches_dirty)
620 flush_domains = I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS;
621
622 ret = ring->emit_flush(req, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS, flush_domains);
623 if (ret)
624 return ret;
625
626 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = false;
627 return 0;
628}
629
630static int execlists_move_to_gpu(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
631 struct list_head *vmas)
632{
633 const unsigned other_rings = ~intel_ring_flag(req->ring);
634 struct i915_vma *vma;
635 uint32_t flush_domains = 0;
636 bool flush_chipset = false;
637 int ret;
638
639 list_for_each_entry(vma, vmas, exec_list) {
640 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = vma->obj;
641
642 if (obj->active & other_rings) {
643 ret = i915_gem_object_sync(obj, req->ring, &req);
644 if (ret)
645 return ret;
646 }
647
648 if (obj->base.write_domain & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU)
649 flush_chipset |= i915_gem_clflush_object(obj, false);
650
651 flush_domains |= obj->base.write_domain;
652 }
653
654 if (flush_domains & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_GTT)
655 wmb();
656
657 /* Unconditionally invalidate gpu caches and ensure that we do flush
658 * any residual writes from the previous batch.
659 */
660 return logical_ring_invalidate_all_caches(req);
661}
662
663int intel_logical_ring_alloc_request_extras(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
664{
665 int ret;
666
667 request->ringbuf = request->ctx->engine[request->ring->id].ringbuf;
668
669 if (request->ctx != request->ring->default_context) {
670 ret = intel_lr_context_pin(request);
671 if (ret)
672 return ret;
673 }
674
675 return 0;
676}
677
678static int logical_ring_wait_for_space(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
679 int bytes)
680{
681 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
682 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
683 struct drm_i915_gem_request *target;
684 unsigned space;
685 int ret;
686
687 if (intel_ring_space(ringbuf) >= bytes)
688 return 0;
689
690 /* The whole point of reserving space is to not wait! */
691 WARN_ON(ringbuf->reserved_in_use);
692
693 list_for_each_entry(target, &ring->request_list, list) {
694 /*
695 * The request queue is per-engine, so can contain requests
696 * from multiple ringbuffers. Here, we must ignore any that
697 * aren't from the ringbuffer we're considering.
698 */
699 if (target->ringbuf != ringbuf)
700 continue;
701
702 /* Would completion of this request free enough space? */
703 space = __intel_ring_space(target->postfix, ringbuf->tail,
704 ringbuf->size);
705 if (space >= bytes)
706 break;
707 }
708
709 if (WARN_ON(&target->list == &ring->request_list))
710 return -ENOSPC;
711
712 ret = i915_wait_request(target);
713 if (ret)
714 return ret;
715
716 ringbuf->space = space;
717 return 0;
718}
719
720/*
721 * intel_logical_ring_advance_and_submit() - advance the tail and submit the workload
722 * @request: Request to advance the logical ringbuffer of.
723 *
724 * The tail is updated in our logical ringbuffer struct, not in the actual context. What
725 * really happens during submission is that the context and current tail will be placed
726 * on a queue waiting for the ELSP to be ready to accept a new context submission. At that
727 * point, the tail *inside* the context is updated and the ELSP written to.
728 */
729static void
730intel_logical_ring_advance_and_submit(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
731{
732 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = request->ring;
733 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = request->i915;
734
735 intel_logical_ring_advance(request->ringbuf);
736
737 request->tail = request->ringbuf->tail;
738
739 if (intel_ring_stopped(ring))
740 return;
741
742 if (dev_priv->guc.execbuf_client)
743 i915_guc_submit(dev_priv->guc.execbuf_client, request);
744 else
745 execlists_context_queue(request);
746}
747
748static void __wrap_ring_buffer(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
749{
750#ifndef __NetBSD__
751 uint32_t __iomem *virt;
752#endif
753 int rem = ringbuf->size - ringbuf->tail;
754
755#ifdef __NetBSD__
756 bus_space_set_region_4(ringbuf->bst, ringbuf->bsh, ringbuf->tail,
757 MI_NOOP, rem/4);
758#else
759 virt = ringbuf->virtual_start + ringbuf->tail;
760 rem /= 4;
761 while (rem--)
762 iowrite32(MI_NOOP, virt++);
763#endif
764
765 ringbuf->tail = 0;
766 intel_ring_update_space(ringbuf);
767}
768
769static int logical_ring_prepare(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req, int bytes)
770{
771 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
772 int remain_usable = ringbuf->effective_size - ringbuf->tail;
773 int remain_actual = ringbuf->size - ringbuf->tail;
774 int ret, total_bytes, wait_bytes = 0;
775 bool need_wrap = false;
776
777 if (ringbuf->reserved_in_use)
778 total_bytes = bytes;
779 else
780 total_bytes = bytes + ringbuf->reserved_size;
781
782 if (unlikely(bytes > remain_usable)) {
783 /*
784 * Not enough space for the basic request. So need to flush
785 * out the remainder and then wait for base + reserved.
786 */
787 wait_bytes = remain_actual + total_bytes;
788 need_wrap = true;
789 } else {
790 if (unlikely(total_bytes > remain_usable)) {
791 /*
792 * The base request will fit but the reserved space
793 * falls off the end. So don't need an immediate wrap
794 * and only need to effectively wait for the reserved
795 * size space from the start of ringbuffer.
796 */
797 wait_bytes = remain_actual + ringbuf->reserved_size;
798 } else if (total_bytes > ringbuf->space) {
799 /* No wrapping required, just waiting. */
800 wait_bytes = total_bytes;
801 }
802 }
803
804 if (wait_bytes) {
805 ret = logical_ring_wait_for_space(req, wait_bytes);
806 if (unlikely(ret))
807 return ret;
808
809 if (need_wrap)
810 __wrap_ring_buffer(ringbuf);
811 }
812
813 return 0;
814}
815
816/**
817 * intel_logical_ring_begin() - prepare the logical ringbuffer to accept some commands
818 *
819 * @req: The request to start some new work for
820 * @num_dwords: number of DWORDs that we plan to write to the ringbuffer.
821 *
822 * The ringbuffer might not be ready to accept the commands right away (maybe it needs to
823 * be wrapped, or wait a bit for the tail to be updated). This function takes care of that
824 * and also preallocates a request (every workload submission is still mediated through
825 * requests, same as it did with legacy ringbuffer submission).
826 *
827 * Return: non-zero if the ringbuffer is not ready to be written to.
828 */
829int intel_logical_ring_begin(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req, int num_dwords)
830{
831 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv;
832 int ret;
833
834 WARN_ON(req == NULL);
835 dev_priv = req->ring->dev->dev_private;
836
837 ret = i915_gem_check_wedge(&dev_priv->gpu_error,
838 dev_priv->mm.interruptible);
839 if (ret)
840 return ret;
841
842 ret = logical_ring_prepare(req, num_dwords * sizeof(uint32_t));
843 if (ret)
844 return ret;
845
846 req->ringbuf->space -= num_dwords * sizeof(uint32_t);
847 return 0;
848}
849
850int intel_logical_ring_reserve_space(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
851{
852 /*
853 * The first call merely notes the reserve request and is common for
854 * all back ends. The subsequent localised _begin() call actually
855 * ensures that the reservation is available. Without the begin, if
856 * the request creator immediately submitted the request without
857 * adding any commands to it then there might not actually be
858 * sufficient room for the submission commands.
859 */
860 intel_ring_reserved_space_reserve(request->ringbuf, MIN_SPACE_FOR_ADD_REQUEST);
861
862 return intel_logical_ring_begin(request, 0);
863}
864
865/**
866 * execlists_submission() - submit a batchbuffer for execution, Execlists style
867 * @dev: DRM device.
868 * @file: DRM file.
869 * @ring: Engine Command Streamer to submit to.
870 * @ctx: Context to employ for this submission.
871 * @args: execbuffer call arguments.
872 * @vmas: list of vmas.
873 * @batch_obj: the batchbuffer to submit.
874 * @exec_start: batchbuffer start virtual address pointer.
875 * @dispatch_flags: translated execbuffer call flags.
876 *
877 * This is the evil twin version of i915_gem_ringbuffer_submission. It abstracts
878 * away the submission details of the execbuffer ioctl call.
879 *
880 * Return: non-zero if the submission fails.
881 */
882int intel_execlists_submission(struct i915_execbuffer_params *params,
883 struct drm_i915_gem_execbuffer2 *args,
884 struct list_head *vmas)
885{
886 struct drm_device *dev = params->dev;
887 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = params->ring;
888 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
889 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = params->ctx->engine[ring->id].ringbuf;
890 u64 exec_start;
891 int instp_mode;
892 u32 instp_mask;
893 int ret;
894
895 instp_mode = args->flags & I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_MASK;
896 instp_mask = I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_MASK;
897 switch (instp_mode) {
898 case I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_GENERAL:
899 case I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_ABSOLUTE:
900 case I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_SURFACE:
901 if (instp_mode != 0 && ring != &dev_priv->ring[RCS]) {
902 DRM_DEBUG("non-0 rel constants mode on non-RCS\n");
903 return -EINVAL;
904 }
905
906 if (instp_mode != dev_priv->relative_constants_mode) {
907 if (instp_mode == I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_SURFACE) {
908 DRM_DEBUG("rel surface constants mode invalid on gen5+\n");
909 return -EINVAL;
910 }
911
912 /* The HW changed the meaning on this bit on gen6 */
913 instp_mask &= ~I915_EXEC_CONSTANTS_REL_SURFACE;
914 }
915 break;
916 default:
917 DRM_DEBUG("execbuf with unknown constants: %d\n", instp_mode);
918 return -EINVAL;
919 }
920
921 if (args->flags & I915_EXEC_GEN7_SOL_RESET) {
922 DRM_DEBUG("sol reset is gen7 only\n");
923 return -EINVAL;
924 }
925
926 ret = execlists_move_to_gpu(params->request, vmas);
927 if (ret)
928 return ret;
929
930 if (ring == &dev_priv->ring[RCS] &&
931 instp_mode != dev_priv->relative_constants_mode) {
932 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(params->request, 4);
933 if (ret)
934 return ret;
935
936 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
937 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1));
938 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, INSTPM);
939 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, instp_mask << 16 | instp_mode);
940 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
941
942 dev_priv->relative_constants_mode = instp_mode;
943 }
944
945 exec_start = params->batch_obj_vm_offset +
946 args->batch_start_offset;
947
948 ret = ring->emit_bb_start(params->request, exec_start, params->dispatch_flags);
949 if (ret)
950 return ret;
951
952 trace_i915_gem_ring_dispatch(params->request, params->dispatch_flags);
953
954 i915_gem_execbuffer_move_to_active(vmas, params->request);
955 i915_gem_execbuffer_retire_commands(params);
956
957 return 0;
958}
959
960void intel_execlists_retire_requests(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
961{
962 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req, *tmp;
963 struct list_head retired_list;
964
965 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&ring->dev->struct_mutex));
966 if (list_empty(&ring->execlist_retired_req_list))
967 return;
968
969 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&retired_list);
970 spin_lock_irq(&ring->execlist_lock);
971 list_replace_init(&ring->execlist_retired_req_list, &retired_list);
972 spin_unlock_irq(&ring->execlist_lock);
973
974 list_for_each_entry_safe(req, tmp, &retired_list, execlist_link) {
975 struct intel_context *ctx = req->ctx;
976 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj =
977 ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
978
979 if (ctx_obj && (ctx != ring->default_context))
980 intel_lr_context_unpin(req);
981 list_del(&req->execlist_link);
982 i915_gem_request_unreference(req);
983 }
984}
985
986void intel_logical_ring_stop(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
987{
988 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
989 int ret;
990
991 if (!intel_ring_initialized(ring))
992 return;
993
994 ret = intel_ring_idle(ring);
995 if (ret && !i915_reset_in_progress(&to_i915(ring->dev)->gpu_error))
996 DRM_ERROR("failed to quiesce %s whilst cleaning up: %d\n",
997 ring->name, ret);
998
999 /* TODO: Is this correct with Execlists enabled? */
1000 I915_WRITE_MODE(ring, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(STOP_RING));
1001 if (wait_for_atomic((I915_READ_MODE(ring) & MODE_IDLE) != 0, 1000)) {
1002 DRM_ERROR("%s :timed out trying to stop ring\n", ring->name);
1003 return;
1004 }
1005 I915_WRITE_MODE(ring, _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(STOP_RING));
1006}
1007
1008int logical_ring_flush_all_caches(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1009{
1010 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1011 int ret;
1012
1013 if (!ring->gpu_caches_dirty)
1014 return 0;
1015
1016 ret = ring->emit_flush(req, 0, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS);
1017 if (ret)
1018 return ret;
1019
1020 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = false;
1021 return 0;
1022}
1023
1024static int intel_lr_context_do_pin(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1025 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj,
1026 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
1027{
1028 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1029 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1030 int ret = 0;
1031
1032 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&ring->dev->struct_mutex));
1033 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(ctx_obj, GEN8_LR_CONTEXT_ALIGN,
1034 PIN_OFFSET_BIAS | GUC_WOPCM_TOP);
1035 if (ret)
1036 return ret;
1037
1038 ret = intel_pin_and_map_ringbuffer_obj(ring->dev, ringbuf);
1039 if (ret)
1040 goto unpin_ctx_obj;
1041
1042 ctx_obj->dirty = true;
1043
1044 /* Invalidate GuC TLB. */
1045 if (i915.enable_guc_submission)
1046 I915_WRITE(GEN8_GTCR, GEN8_GTCR_INVALIDATE);
1047
1048 return ret;
1049
1050unpin_ctx_obj:
1051 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ctx_obj);
1052
1053 return ret;
1054}
1055
1056static int intel_lr_context_pin(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq)
1057{
1058 int ret = 0;
1059 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = rq->ring;
1060 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj = rq->ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
1061 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = rq->ringbuf;
1062
1063 if (rq->ctx->engine[ring->id].pin_count++ == 0) {
1064 ret = intel_lr_context_do_pin(ring, ctx_obj, ringbuf);
1065 if (ret)
1066 goto reset_pin_count;
1067 }
1068 return ret;
1069
1070reset_pin_count:
1071 rq->ctx->engine[ring->id].pin_count = 0;
1072 return ret;
1073}
1074
1075void intel_lr_context_unpin(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq)
1076{
1077 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = rq->ring;
1078 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj = rq->ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
1079 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = rq->ringbuf;
1080
1081 if (ctx_obj) {
1082 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&ring->dev->struct_mutex));
1083 if (--rq->ctx->engine[ring->id].pin_count == 0) {
1084 intel_unpin_ringbuffer_obj(ringbuf);
1085 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ctx_obj);
1086 }
1087 }
1088}
1089
1090static int intel_logical_ring_workarounds_emit(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1091{
1092 int ret, i;
1093 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1094 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
1095 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1096 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1097 struct i915_workarounds *w = &dev_priv->workarounds;
1098
1099 if (WARN_ON_ONCE(w->count == 0))
1100 return 0;
1101
1102 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = true;
1103 ret = logical_ring_flush_all_caches(req);
1104 if (ret)
1105 return ret;
1106
1107 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(req, w->count * 2 + 2);
1108 if (ret)
1109 return ret;
1110
1111 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(w->count));
1112 for (i = 0; i < w->count; i++) {
1113 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, w->reg[i].addr);
1114 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, w->reg[i].value);
1115 }
1116 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
1117
1118 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
1119
1120 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = true;
1121 ret = logical_ring_flush_all_caches(req);
1122 if (ret)
1123 return ret;
1124
1125 return 0;
1126}
1127
1128#define wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, cmd) \
1129 do { \
1130 int __index = (index)++; \
1131 if (WARN_ON(__index >= (PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(uint32_t)))) { \
1132 return -ENOSPC; \
1133 } \
1134 batch[__index] = (cmd); \
1135 } while (0)
1136
1137
1138/*
1139 * In this WA we need to set GEN8_L3SQCREG4[21:21] and reset it after
1140 * PIPE_CONTROL instruction. This is required for the flush to happen correctly
1141 * but there is a slight complication as this is applied in WA batch where the
1142 * values are only initialized once so we cannot take register value at the
1143 * beginning and reuse it further; hence we save its value to memory, upload a
1144 * constant value with bit21 set and then we restore it back with the saved value.
1145 * To simplify the WA, a constant value is formed by using the default value
1146 * of this register. This shouldn't be a problem because we are only modifying
1147 * it for a short period and this batch in non-premptible. We can ofcourse
1148 * use additional instructions that read the actual value of the register
1149 * at that time and set our bit of interest but it makes the WA complicated.
1150 *
1151 * This WA is also required for Gen9 so extracting as a function avoids
1152 * code duplication.
1153 */
1154static inline int gen8_emit_flush_coherentl3_wa(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1155 uint32_t *const batch,
1156 uint32_t index)
1157{
1158 uint32_t l3sqc4_flush = (0x40400000 | GEN8_LQSC_FLUSH_COHERENT_LINES);
1159
1160 /*
1161 * WaDisableLSQCROPERFforOCL:skl
1162 * This WA is implemented in skl_init_clock_gating() but since
1163 * this batch updates GEN8_L3SQCREG4 with default value we need to
1164 * set this bit here to retain the WA during flush.
1165 */
1166 if (IS_SKYLAKE(ring->dev) && INTEL_REVID(ring->dev) <= SKL_REVID_E0)
1167 l3sqc4_flush |= GEN8_LQSC_RO_PERF_DIS;
1168
1169 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, (MI_STORE_REGISTER_MEM_GEN8 |
1170 MI_SRM_LRM_GLOBAL_GTT));
1171 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, GEN8_L3SQCREG4);
1172 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 256);
1173 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1174
1175 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1));
1176 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, GEN8_L3SQCREG4);
1177 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, l3sqc4_flush);
1178
1179 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(6));
1180 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, (PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL |
1181 PIPE_CONTROL_DC_FLUSH_ENABLE));
1182 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1183 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1184 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1185 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1186
1187 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, (MI_LOAD_REGISTER_MEM_GEN8 |
1188 MI_SRM_LRM_GLOBAL_GTT));
1189 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, GEN8_L3SQCREG4);
1190 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 256);
1191 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1192
1193 return index;
1194}
1195
1196static inline uint32_t wa_ctx_start(struct i915_wa_ctx_bb *wa_ctx,
1197 uint32_t offset,
1198 uint32_t start_alignment)
1199{
1200#ifdef __NetBSD__ /* XXX ALIGN means something else */
1201 return wa_ctx->offset = round_up(offset, start_alignment);
1202#else
1203 return wa_ctx->offset = ALIGN(offset, start_alignment);
1204#endif
1205}
1206
1207static inline int wa_ctx_end(struct i915_wa_ctx_bb *wa_ctx,
1208 uint32_t offset,
1209 uint32_t size_alignment)
1210{
1211 wa_ctx->size = offset - wa_ctx->offset;
1212
1213 WARN(wa_ctx->size % size_alignment,
1214 "wa_ctx_bb failed sanity checks: size %d is not aligned to %d\n",
1215 wa_ctx->size, size_alignment);
1216 return 0;
1217}
1218
1219/**
1220 * gen8_init_indirectctx_bb() - initialize indirect ctx batch with WA
1221 *
1222 * @ring: only applicable for RCS
1223 * @wa_ctx: structure representing wa_ctx
1224 * offset: specifies start of the batch, should be cache-aligned. This is updated
1225 * with the offset value received as input.
1226 * size: size of the batch in DWORDS but HW expects in terms of cachelines
1227 * @batch: page in which WA are loaded
1228 * @offset: This field specifies the start of the batch, it should be
1229 * cache-aligned otherwise it is adjusted accordingly.
1230 * Typically we only have one indirect_ctx and per_ctx batch buffer which are
1231 * initialized at the beginning and shared across all contexts but this field
1232 * helps us to have multiple batches at different offsets and select them based
1233 * on a criteria. At the moment this batch always start at the beginning of the page
1234 * and at this point we don't have multiple wa_ctx batch buffers.
1235 *
1236 * The number of WA applied are not known at the beginning; we use this field
1237 * to return the no of DWORDS written.
1238 *
1239 * It is to be noted that this batch does not contain MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END
1240 * so it adds NOOPs as padding to make it cacheline aligned.
1241 * MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END will be added to perctx batch and both of them together
1242 * makes a complete batch buffer.
1243 *
1244 * Return: non-zero if we exceed the PAGE_SIZE limit.
1245 */
1246
1247static int gen8_init_indirectctx_bb(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1248 struct i915_wa_ctx_bb *wa_ctx,
1249 uint32_t *const batch,
1250 uint32_t *offset)
1251{
1252 uint32_t scratch_addr;
1253 uint32_t index = wa_ctx_start(wa_ctx, *offset, CACHELINE_DWORDS);
1254
1255 /* WaDisableCtxRestoreArbitration:bdw,chv */
1256 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_ARB_ON_OFF | MI_ARB_DISABLE);
1257
1258 /* WaFlushCoherentL3CacheLinesAtContextSwitch:bdw */
1259 if (IS_BROADWELL(ring->dev)) {
1260 int rc = gen8_emit_flush_coherentl3_wa(ring, batch, index);
1261 if (rc < 0)
1262 return rc;
1263 index = rc;
1264 }
1265
1266 /* WaClearSlmSpaceAtContextSwitch:bdw,chv */
1267 /* Actual scratch location is at 128 bytes offset */
1268 scratch_addr = ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2*CACHELINE_BYTES;
1269
1270 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(6));
1271 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, (PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH_L3 |
1272 PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT_IVB |
1273 PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL |
1274 PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE));
1275 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, scratch_addr);
1276 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1277 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1278 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, 0);
1279
1280 /* Pad to end of cacheline */
1281 while (index % CACHELINE_DWORDS)
1282 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_NOOP);
1283
1284 /*
1285 * MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END is not required in Indirect ctx BB because
1286 * execution depends on the length specified in terms of cache lines
1287 * in the register CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX
1288 */
1289
1290 return wa_ctx_end(wa_ctx, *offset = index, CACHELINE_DWORDS);
1291}
1292
1293/**
1294 * gen8_init_perctx_bb() - initialize per ctx batch with WA
1295 *
1296 * @ring: only applicable for RCS
1297 * @wa_ctx: structure representing wa_ctx
1298 * offset: specifies start of the batch, should be cache-aligned.
1299 * size: size of the batch in DWORDS but HW expects in terms of cachelines
1300 * @batch: page in which WA are loaded
1301 * @offset: This field specifies the start of this batch.
1302 * This batch is started immediately after indirect_ctx batch. Since we ensure
1303 * that indirect_ctx ends on a cacheline this batch is aligned automatically.
1304 *
1305 * The number of DWORDS written are returned using this field.
1306 *
1307 * This batch is terminated with MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END and so we need not add padding
1308 * to align it with cacheline as padding after MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END is redundant.
1309 */
1310static int gen8_init_perctx_bb(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1311 struct i915_wa_ctx_bb *wa_ctx,
1312 uint32_t *const batch,
1313 uint32_t *offset)
1314{
1315 uint32_t index = wa_ctx_start(wa_ctx, *offset, CACHELINE_DWORDS);
1316
1317 /* WaDisableCtxRestoreArbitration:bdw,chv */
1318 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_ARB_ON_OFF | MI_ARB_ENABLE);
1319
1320 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END);
1321
1322 return wa_ctx_end(wa_ctx, *offset = index, 1);
1323}
1324
1325static int gen9_init_indirectctx_bb(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1326 struct i915_wa_ctx_bb *wa_ctx,
1327 uint32_t *const batch,
1328 uint32_t *offset)
1329{
1330 int ret;
1331 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1332 uint32_t index = wa_ctx_start(wa_ctx, *offset, CACHELINE_DWORDS);
1333
1334 /* WaDisableCtxRestoreArbitration:skl,bxt */
1335 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_D0)) ||
1336 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0)))
1337 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_ARB_ON_OFF | MI_ARB_DISABLE);
1338
1339 /* WaFlushCoherentL3CacheLinesAtContextSwitch:skl,bxt */
1340 ret = gen8_emit_flush_coherentl3_wa(ring, batch, index);
1341 if (ret < 0)
1342 return ret;
1343 index = ret;
1344
1345 /* Pad to end of cacheline */
1346 while (index % CACHELINE_DWORDS)
1347 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_NOOP);
1348
1349 return wa_ctx_end(wa_ctx, *offset = index, CACHELINE_DWORDS);
1350}
1351
1352static int gen9_init_perctx_bb(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
1353 struct i915_wa_ctx_bb *wa_ctx,
1354 uint32_t *const batch,
1355 uint32_t *offset)
1356{
1357 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1358 uint32_t index = wa_ctx_start(wa_ctx, *offset, CACHELINE_DWORDS);
1359
1360 /* WaSetDisablePixMaskCammingAndRhwoInCommonSliceChicken:skl,bxt */
1361 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_B0)) ||
1362 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0))) {
1363 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1));
1364 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, GEN9_SLICE_COMMON_ECO_CHICKEN0);
1365 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index,
1366 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(DISABLE_PIXEL_MASK_CAMMING));
1367 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_NOOP);
1368 }
1369
1370 /* WaDisableCtxRestoreArbitration:skl,bxt */
1371 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_D0)) ||
1372 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0)))
1373 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_ARB_ON_OFF | MI_ARB_ENABLE);
1374
1375 wa_ctx_emit(batch, index, MI_BATCH_BUFFER_END);
1376
1377 return wa_ctx_end(wa_ctx, *offset = index, 1);
1378}
1379
1380static int lrc_setup_wa_ctx_obj(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, u32 size)
1381{
1382 int ret;
1383
1384 ring->wa_ctx.obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(ring->dev, PAGE_ALIGN(size));
1385 if (!ring->wa_ctx.obj) {
1386 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("alloc LRC WA ctx backing obj failed.\n");
1387 return -ENOMEM;
1388 }
1389
1390 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(ring->wa_ctx.obj, PAGE_SIZE, 0);
1391 if (ret) {
1392 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("pin LRC WA ctx backing obj failed: %d\n",
1393 ret);
1394 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ring->wa_ctx.obj->base);
1395 return ret;
1396 }
1397
1398 return 0;
1399}
1400
1401static void lrc_destroy_wa_ctx_obj(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1402{
1403 if (ring->wa_ctx.obj) {
1404 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ring->wa_ctx.obj);
1405 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ring->wa_ctx.obj->base);
1406 ring->wa_ctx.obj = NULL;
1407 }
1408}
1409
1410static int intel_init_workaround_bb(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1411{
1412 int ret;
1413 uint32_t *batch;
1414 uint32_t offset;
1415 struct page *page;
1416 struct i915_ctx_workarounds *wa_ctx = &ring->wa_ctx;
1417
1418 WARN_ON(ring->id != RCS);
1419
1420 /* update this when WA for higher Gen are added */
1421 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen > 9) {
1422 DRM_ERROR("WA batch buffer is not initialized for Gen%d\n",
1423 INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen);
1424 return 0;
1425 }
1426
1427 /* some WA perform writes to scratch page, ensure it is valid */
1428 if (ring->scratch.obj == NULL) {
1429 DRM_ERROR("scratch page not allocated for %s\n", ring->name);
1430 return -EINVAL;
1431 }
1432
1433 ret = lrc_setup_wa_ctx_obj(ring, PAGE_SIZE);
1434 if (ret) {
1435 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Failed to setup context WA page: %d\n", ret);
1436 return ret;
1437 }
1438
1439 page = i915_gem_object_get_page(wa_ctx->obj, 0);
1440 batch = kmap_atomic(page);
1441 offset = 0;
1442
1443 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen == 8) {
1444 ret = gen8_init_indirectctx_bb(ring,
1445 &wa_ctx->indirect_ctx,
1446 batch,
1447 &offset);
1448 if (ret)
1449 goto out;
1450
1451 ret = gen8_init_perctx_bb(ring,
1452 &wa_ctx->per_ctx,
1453 batch,
1454 &offset);
1455 if (ret)
1456 goto out;
1457 } else if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen == 9) {
1458 ret = gen9_init_indirectctx_bb(ring,
1459 &wa_ctx->indirect_ctx,
1460 batch,
1461 &offset);
1462 if (ret)
1463 goto out;
1464
1465 ret = gen9_init_perctx_bb(ring,
1466 &wa_ctx->per_ctx,
1467 batch,
1468 &offset);
1469 if (ret)
1470 goto out;
1471 }
1472
1473out:
1474 kunmap_atomic(batch);
1475 if (ret)
1476 lrc_destroy_wa_ctx_obj(ring);
1477
1478 return ret;
1479}
1480
1481static int gen8_init_common_ring(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1482{
1483 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1484 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1485 u8 next_context_status_buffer_hw;
1486
1487 lrc_setup_hardware_status_page(ring,
1488 ring->default_context->engine[ring->id].state);
1489
1490 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~(ring->irq_enable_mask | ring->irq_keep_mask));
1491 I915_WRITE(RING_HWSTAM(ring->mmio_base), 0xffffffff);
1492
1493 if (ring->status_page.obj) {
1494 I915_WRITE(RING_HWS_PGA(ring->mmio_base),
1495 (u32)ring->status_page.gfx_addr);
1496 POSTING_READ(RING_HWS_PGA(ring->mmio_base));
1497 }
1498
1499 I915_WRITE(RING_MODE_GEN7(ring),
1500 _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(GFX_REPLAY_MODE) |
1501 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GFX_RUN_LIST_ENABLE));
1502 POSTING_READ(RING_MODE_GEN7(ring));
1503
1504 /*
1505 * Instead of resetting the Context Status Buffer (CSB) read pointer to
1506 * zero, we need to read the write pointer from hardware and use its
1507 * value because "this register is power context save restored".
1508 * Effectively, these states have been observed:
1509 *
1510 * | Suspend-to-idle (freeze) | Suspend-to-RAM (mem) |
1511 * BDW | CSB regs not reset | CSB regs reset |
1512 * CHT | CSB regs not reset | CSB regs not reset |
1513 */
1514 next_context_status_buffer_hw = (I915_READ(RING_CONTEXT_STATUS_PTR(ring))
1515 & GEN8_CSB_PTR_MASK);
1516
1517 /*
1518 * When the CSB registers are reset (also after power-up / gpu reset),
1519 * CSB write pointer is set to all 1's, which is not valid, use '5' in
1520 * this special case, so the first element read is CSB[0].
1521 */
1522 if (next_context_status_buffer_hw == GEN8_CSB_PTR_MASK)
1523 next_context_status_buffer_hw = (GEN8_CSB_ENTRIES - 1);
1524
1525 ring->next_context_status_buffer = next_context_status_buffer_hw;
1526 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Execlists enabled for %s\n", ring->name);
1527
1528 memset(&ring->hangcheck, 0, sizeof(ring->hangcheck));
1529
1530 return 0;
1531}
1532
1533static int gen8_init_render_ring(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1534{
1535 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1536 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1537 int ret;
1538
1539 ret = gen8_init_common_ring(ring);
1540 if (ret)
1541 return ret;
1542
1543 /* We need to disable the AsyncFlip performance optimisations in order
1544 * to use MI_WAIT_FOR_EVENT within the CS. It should already be
1545 * programmed to '1' on all products.
1546 *
1547 * WaDisableAsyncFlipPerfMode:snb,ivb,hsw,vlv,bdw,chv
1548 */
1549 I915_WRITE(MI_MODE, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(ASYNC_FLIP_PERF_DISABLE));
1550
1551 I915_WRITE(INSTPM, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(INSTPM_FORCE_ORDERING));
1552
1553 return init_workarounds_ring(ring);
1554}
1555
1556static int gen9_init_render_ring(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1557{
1558 int ret;
1559
1560 ret = gen8_init_common_ring(ring);
1561 if (ret)
1562 return ret;
1563
1564 return init_workarounds_ring(ring);
1565}
1566
1567static int intel_logical_ring_emit_pdps(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1568{
1569 struct i915_hw_ppgtt *ppgtt = req->ctx->ppgtt;
1570 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1571 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
1572 const int num_lri_cmds = GEN8_LEGACY_PDPES * 2;
1573 int i, ret;
1574
1575 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(req, num_lri_cmds * 2 + 2);
1576 if (ret)
1577 return ret;
1578
1579 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(num_lri_cmds));
1580 for (i = GEN8_LEGACY_PDPES - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1581 const dma_addr_t pd_daddr = i915_page_dir_dma_addr(ppgtt, i);
1582
1583 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, GEN8_RING_PDP_UDW(ring, i));
1584 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, upper_32_bits(pd_daddr));
1585 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, GEN8_RING_PDP_LDW(ring, i));
1586 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, lower_32_bits(pd_daddr));
1587 }
1588
1589 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
1590 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
1591
1592 return 0;
1593}
1594
1595static int gen8_emit_bb_start(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
1596 u64 offset, unsigned dispatch_flags)
1597{
1598 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = req->ringbuf;
1599 bool ppgtt = !(dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE);
1600 int ret;
1601
1602 /* Don't rely in hw updating PDPs, specially in lite-restore.
1603 * Ideally, we should set Force PD Restore in ctx descriptor,
1604 * but we can't. Force Restore would be a second option, but
1605 * it is unsafe in case of lite-restore (because the ctx is
1606 * not idle). PML4 is allocated during ppgtt init so this is
1607 * not needed in 48-bit.*/
1608 if (req->ctx->ppgtt &&
1609 (intel_ring_flag(req->ring) & req->ctx->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings)) {
1610 if (!USES_FULL_48BIT_PPGTT(req->i915) &&
1611 !intel_vgpu_active(req->i915->dev)) {
1612 ret = intel_logical_ring_emit_pdps(req);
1613 if (ret)
1614 return ret;
1615 }
1616
1617 req->ctx->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings &= ~intel_ring_flag(req->ring);
1618 }
1619
1620 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(req, 4);
1621 if (ret)
1622 return ret;
1623
1624 /* FIXME(BDW): Address space and security selectors. */
1625 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START_GEN8 |
1626 (ppgtt<<8) |
1627 (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_RS ?
1628 MI_BATCH_RESOURCE_STREAMER : 0));
1629 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, lower_32_bits(offset));
1630 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, upper_32_bits(offset));
1631 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
1632 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
1633
1634 return 0;
1635}
1636
1637static bool gen8_logical_ring_get_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1638{
1639 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1640 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1641 unsigned long flags;
1642
1643 if (WARN_ON(!intel_irqs_enabled(dev_priv)))
1644 return false;
1645
1646 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1647 if (ring->irq_refcount++ == 0) {
1648 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~(ring->irq_enable_mask | ring->irq_keep_mask));
1649 POSTING_READ(RING_IMR(ring->mmio_base));
1650 }
1651 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1652
1653 return true;
1654}
1655
1656static void gen8_logical_ring_put_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1657{
1658 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1659 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1660 unsigned long flags;
1661
1662 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1663 if (--ring->irq_refcount == 0) {
1664 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~ring->irq_keep_mask);
1665 POSTING_READ(RING_IMR(ring->mmio_base));
1666 }
1667 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1668}
1669
1670static int gen8_emit_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request,
1671 u32 invalidate_domains,
1672 u32 unused)
1673{
1674 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = request->ringbuf;
1675 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = ringbuf->ring;
1676 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1677 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1678 uint32_t cmd;
1679 int ret;
1680
1681 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(request, 4);
1682 if (ret)
1683 return ret;
1684
1685 cmd = MI_FLUSH_DW + 1;
1686
1687 /* We always require a command barrier so that subsequent
1688 * commands, such as breadcrumb interrupts, are strictly ordered
1689 * wrt the contents of the write cache being flushed to memory
1690 * (and thus being coherent from the CPU).
1691 */
1692 cmd |= MI_FLUSH_DW_STORE_INDEX | MI_FLUSH_DW_OP_STOREDW;
1693
1694 if (invalidate_domains & I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS) {
1695 cmd |= MI_INVALIDATE_TLB;
1696 if (ring == &dev_priv->ring[VCS])
1697 cmd |= MI_INVALIDATE_BSD;
1698 }
1699
1700 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, cmd);
1701 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf,
1702 I915_GEM_HWS_SCRATCH_ADDR |
1703 MI_FLUSH_DW_USE_GTT);
1704 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0); /* upper addr */
1705 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0); /* value */
1706 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
1707
1708 return 0;
1709}
1710
1711static int gen8_emit_flush_render(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request,
1712 u32 invalidate_domains,
1713 u32 flush_domains)
1714{
1715 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = request->ringbuf;
1716 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = ringbuf->ring;
1717 u32 scratch_addr = ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
1718 bool vf_flush_wa;
1719 u32 flags = 0;
1720 int ret;
1721
1722 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL;
1723
1724 if (flush_domains) {
1725 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_RENDER_TARGET_CACHE_FLUSH;
1726 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DEPTH_CACHE_FLUSH;
1727 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DC_FLUSH_ENABLE;
1728 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH_ENABLE;
1729 }
1730
1731 if (invalidate_domains) {
1732 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TLB_INVALIDATE;
1733 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_INSTRUCTION_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
1734 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TEXTURE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
1735 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_VF_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
1736 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CONST_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
1737 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_STATE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
1738 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE;
1739 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT_IVB;
1740 }
1741
1742 /*
1743 * On GEN9+ Before VF_CACHE_INVALIDATE we need to emit a NULL pipe
1744 * control.
1745 */
1746 vf_flush_wa = INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 9 &&
1747 flags & PIPE_CONTROL_VF_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
1748
1749 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(request, vf_flush_wa ? 12 : 6);
1750 if (ret)
1751 return ret;
1752
1753 if (vf_flush_wa) {
1754 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(6));
1755 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1756 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1757 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1758 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1759 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1760 }
1761
1762 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(6));
1763 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, flags);
1764 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, scratch_addr);
1765 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1766 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1767 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1768 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
1769
1770 return 0;
1771}
1772
1773static u32 gen8_get_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, bool lazy_coherency)
1774{
1775 return intel_read_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX);
1776}
1777
1778static void gen8_set_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, u32 seqno)
1779{
1780 intel_write_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX, seqno);
1781}
1782
1783static u32 bxt_a_get_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, bool lazy_coherency)
1784{
1785
1786 /*
1787 * On BXT A steppings there is a HW coherency issue whereby the
1788 * MI_STORE_DATA_IMM storing the completed request's seqno
1789 * occasionally doesn't invalidate the CPU cache. Work around this by
1790 * clflushing the corresponding cacheline whenever the caller wants
1791 * the coherency to be guaranteed. Note that this cacheline is known
1792 * to be clean at this point, since we only write it in
1793 * bxt_a_set_seqno(), where we also do a clflush after the write. So
1794 * this clflush in practice becomes an invalidate operation.
1795 */
1796
1797 if (!lazy_coherency)
1798 intel_flush_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX);
1799
1800 return intel_read_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX);
1801}
1802
1803static void bxt_a_set_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, u32 seqno)
1804{
1805 intel_write_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX, seqno);
1806
1807 /* See bxt_a_get_seqno() explaining the reason for the clflush. */
1808 intel_flush_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX);
1809}
1810
1811static int gen8_emit_request(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
1812{
1813 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = request->ringbuf;
1814 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = ringbuf->ring;
1815 u32 cmd;
1816 int ret;
1817
1818 /*
1819 * Reserve space for 2 NOOPs at the end of each request to be
1820 * used as a workaround for not being allowed to do lite
1821 * restore with HEAD==TAIL (WaIdleLiteRestore).
1822 */
1823 ret = intel_logical_ring_begin(request, 8);
1824 if (ret)
1825 return ret;
1826
1827 cmd = MI_STORE_DWORD_IMM_GEN4;
1828 cmd |= MI_GLOBAL_GTT;
1829
1830 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, cmd);
1831 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf,
1832 (ring->status_page.gfx_addr +
1833 (I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX << MI_STORE_DWORD_INDEX_SHIFT)));
1834 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, 0);
1835 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, i915_gem_request_get_seqno(request));
1836 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_USER_INTERRUPT);
1837 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
1838 intel_logical_ring_advance_and_submit(request);
1839
1840 /*
1841 * Here we add two extra NOOPs as padding to avoid
1842 * lite restore of a context with HEAD==TAIL.
1843 */
1844 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
1845 intel_logical_ring_emit(ringbuf, MI_NOOP);
1846 intel_logical_ring_advance(ringbuf);
1847
1848 return 0;
1849}
1850
1851static int intel_lr_context_render_state_init(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1852{
1853 struct render_state so;
1854 int ret;
1855
1856 ret = i915_gem_render_state_prepare(req->ring, &so);
1857 if (ret)
1858 return ret;
1859
1860 if (so.rodata == NULL)
1861 return 0;
1862
1863 ret = req->ring->emit_bb_start(req, so.ggtt_offset,
1864 I915_DISPATCH_SECURE);
1865 if (ret)
1866 goto out;
1867
1868 ret = req->ring->emit_bb_start(req,
1869 (so.ggtt_offset + so.aux_batch_offset),
1870 I915_DISPATCH_SECURE);
1871 if (ret)
1872 goto out;
1873
1874 i915_vma_move_to_active(i915_gem_obj_to_ggtt(so.obj), req);
1875
1876out:
1877 i915_gem_render_state_fini(&so);
1878 return ret;
1879}
1880
1881static int gen8_init_rcs_context(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1882{
1883 int ret;
1884
1885 ret = intel_logical_ring_workarounds_emit(req);
1886 if (ret)
1887 return ret;
1888
1889 ret = intel_rcs_context_init_mocs(req);
1890 /*
1891 * Failing to program the MOCS is non-fatal.The system will not
1892 * run at peak performance. So generate an error and carry on.
1893 */
1894 if (ret)
1895 DRM_ERROR("MOCS failed to program: expect performance issues.\n");
1896
1897 return intel_lr_context_render_state_init(req);
1898}
1899
1900/**
1901 * intel_logical_ring_cleanup() - deallocate the Engine Command Streamer
1902 *
1903 * @ring: Engine Command Streamer.
1904 *
1905 */
1906void intel_logical_ring_cleanup(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1907{
1908 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv;
1909
1910 if (!intel_ring_initialized(ring))
1911 return;
1912
1913 dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
1914
1915 intel_logical_ring_stop(ring);
1916 WARN_ON((I915_READ_MODE(ring) & MODE_IDLE) == 0);
1917
1918 if (ring->cleanup)
1919 ring->cleanup(ring);
1920
1921 i915_cmd_parser_fini_ring(ring);
1922 i915_gem_batch_pool_fini(&ring->batch_pool);
1923
1924 if (ring->status_page.obj) {
1925 kunmap(ring->status_page.page);
1926 ring->status_page.obj = NULL;
1927 }
1928
1929 lrc_destroy_wa_ctx_obj(ring);
1930
1931#ifdef __NetBSD__
1932 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&ring->irq_queue);
1933#endif
1934}
1935
1936static int logical_ring_init(struct drm_device *dev, struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1937{
1938 int ret;
1939
1940 /* Intentionally left blank. */
1941 ring->buffer = NULL;
1942
1943 ring->dev = dev;
1944 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->active_list);
1945 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->request_list);
1946 i915_gem_batch_pool_init(dev, &ring->batch_pool);
1947#ifdef __NetBSD__
1948 DRM_INIT_WAITQUEUE(&ring->irq_queue, "i915lrc");
1949#else
1950 init_waitqueue_head(&ring->irq_queue);
1951#endif
1952
1953 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->execlist_queue);
1954 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->execlist_retired_req_list);
1955 spin_lock_init(&ring->execlist_lock);
1956
1957 ret = i915_cmd_parser_init_ring(ring);
1958 if (ret)
1959 return ret;
1960
1961 ret = intel_lr_context_deferred_alloc(ring->default_context, ring);
1962 if (ret)
1963 return ret;
1964
1965 /* As this is the default context, always pin it */
1966 ret = intel_lr_context_do_pin(
1967 ring,
1968 ring->default_context->engine[ring->id].state,
1969 ring->default_context->engine[ring->id].ringbuf);
1970 if (ret) {
1971 DRM_ERROR(
1972 "Failed to pin and map ringbuffer %s: %d\n",
1973 ring->name, ret);
1974 return ret;
1975 }
1976
1977 return ret;
1978}
1979
1980static int logical_render_ring_init(struct drm_device *dev)
1981{
1982 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1983 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[RCS];
1984 int ret;
1985
1986 ring->name = "render ring";
1987 ring->id = RCS;
1988 ring->mmio_base = RENDER_RING_BASE;
1989 ring->irq_enable_mask =
1990 GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT << GEN8_RCS_IRQ_SHIFT;
1991 ring->irq_keep_mask =
1992 GT_CONTEXT_SWITCH_INTERRUPT << GEN8_RCS_IRQ_SHIFT;
1993 if (HAS_L3_DPF(dev))
1994 ring->irq_keep_mask |= GT_RENDER_L3_PARITY_ERROR_INTERRUPT;
1995
1996 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9)
1997 ring->init_hw = gen9_init_render_ring;
1998 else
1999 ring->init_hw = gen8_init_render_ring;
2000 ring->init_context = gen8_init_rcs_context;
2001 ring->cleanup = intel_fini_pipe_control;
2002 if (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0) {
2003 ring->get_seqno = bxt_a_get_seqno;
2004 ring->set_seqno = bxt_a_set_seqno;
2005 } else {
2006 ring->get_seqno = gen8_get_seqno;
2007 ring->set_seqno = gen8_set_seqno;
2008 }
2009 ring->emit_request = gen8_emit_request;
2010 ring->emit_flush = gen8_emit_flush_render;
2011 ring->irq_get = gen8_logical_ring_get_irq;
2012 ring->irq_put = gen8_logical_ring_put_irq;
2013 ring->emit_bb_start = gen8_emit_bb_start;
2014
2015 ring->dev = dev;
2016
2017 ret = intel_init_pipe_control(ring);
2018 if (ret)
2019 return ret;
2020
2021 ret = intel_init_workaround_bb(ring);
2022 if (ret) {
2023 /*
2024 * We continue even if we fail to initialize WA batch
2025 * because we only expect rare glitches but nothing
2026 * critical to prevent us from using GPU
2027 */
2028 DRM_ERROR("WA batch buffer initialization failed: %d\n",
2029 ret);
2030 }
2031
2032 ret = logical_ring_init(dev, ring);
2033 if (ret) {
2034 lrc_destroy_wa_ctx_obj(ring);
2035 }
2036
2037 return ret;
2038}
2039
2040static int logical_bsd_ring_init(struct drm_device *dev)
2041{
2042 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2043 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[VCS];
2044
2045 ring->name = "bsd ring";
2046 ring->id = VCS;
2047 ring->mmio_base = GEN6_BSD_RING_BASE;
2048 ring->irq_enable_mask =
2049 GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT << GEN8_VCS1_IRQ_SHIFT;
2050 ring->irq_keep_mask =
2051 GT_CONTEXT_SWITCH_INTERRUPT << GEN8_VCS1_IRQ_SHIFT;
2052
2053 ring->init_hw = gen8_init_common_ring;
2054 if (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0) {
2055 ring->get_seqno = bxt_a_get_seqno;
2056 ring->set_seqno = bxt_a_set_seqno;
2057 } else {
2058 ring->get_seqno = gen8_get_seqno;
2059 ring->set_seqno = gen8_set_seqno;
2060 }
2061 ring->emit_request = gen8_emit_request;
2062 ring->emit_flush = gen8_emit_flush;
2063 ring->irq_get = gen8_logical_ring_get_irq;
2064 ring->irq_put = gen8_logical_ring_put_irq;
2065 ring->emit_bb_start = gen8_emit_bb_start;
2066
2067 return logical_ring_init(dev, ring);
2068}
