2154
2155/**
2156 * intel_logical_rings_init() - allocate, populate and init the Engine Command Streamers
2157 * @dev: DRM device.
2158 *
2159 * This function inits the engines for an Execlists submission style (the equivalent in the
2160 * legacy ringbuffer submission world would be i915_gem_init_rings). It does it only for
2161 * those engines that are present in the hardware.
2162 *
2163 * Return: non-zero if the initialization failed.
2164 */
2165int intel_logical_rings_init(struct drm_device *dev)
2166{
2167 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2168 int ret;
2169
2170 ret = logical_render_ring_init(dev);
2171 if (ret)
2172 return ret;
2173
2174 if (HAS_BSD(dev)) {
2175 ret = logical_bsd_ring_init(dev);
2176 if (ret)
2177 goto cleanup_render_ring;
2178 }
2179
2180 if (HAS_BLT(dev)) {
2181 ret = logical_blt_ring_init(dev);
2182 if (ret)
2183 goto cleanup_bsd_ring;
2184 }
2185
2186 if (HAS_VEBOX(dev)) {
2187 ret = logical_vebox_ring_init(dev);
2188 if (ret)
2189 goto cleanup_blt_ring;
2190 }
2191
2192 if (HAS_BSD2(dev)) {
2193 ret = logical_bsd2_ring_init(dev);
2194 if (ret)
2195 goto cleanup_vebox_ring;
2196 }
2197
2198 return 0;
2199
2200cleanup_vebox_ring:
2201 intel_logical_ring_cleanup(&dev_priv->ring[VECS]);
2202cleanup_blt_ring:
2203 intel_logical_ring_cleanup(&dev_priv->ring[BCS]);
2204cleanup_bsd_ring:
2205 intel_logical_ring_cleanup(&dev_priv->ring[VCS]);
2206cleanup_render_ring:
2207 intel_logical_ring_cleanup(&dev_priv->ring[RCS]);
2208
2209 return ret;
2210}
2211
2212static u32
2213make_rpcs(struct drm_device *dev)
2214{
2215 u32 rpcs = 0;
2216
2217 /*
2218 * No explicit RPCS request is needed to ensure full
2219 * slice/subslice/EU enablement prior to Gen9.
2220 */
2221 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 9)
2222 return 0;
2223
2224 /*
2225 * Starting in Gen9, render power gating can leave
2226 * slice/subslice/EU in a partially enabled state. We
2227 * must make an explicit request through RPCS for full
2228 * enablement.
2229 */
2230 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->has_slice_pg) {
2231 rpcs |= GEN8_RPCS_S_CNT_ENABLE;
2232 rpcs |= INTEL_INFO(dev)->slice_total <<
2233 GEN8_RPCS_S_CNT_SHIFT;
2234 rpcs |= GEN8_RPCS_ENABLE;
2235 }
2236
2237 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->has_subslice_pg) {
2238 rpcs |= GEN8_RPCS_SS_CNT_ENABLE;
2239 rpcs |= INTEL_INFO(dev)->subslice_per_slice <<
2240 GEN8_RPCS_SS_CNT_SHIFT;
2241 rpcs |= GEN8_RPCS_ENABLE;
2242 }
2243
2244 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->has_eu_pg) {
2245 rpcs |= INTEL_INFO(dev)->eu_per_subslice <<
2246 GEN8_RPCS_EU_MIN_SHIFT;
2247 rpcs |= INTEL_INFO(dev)->eu_per_subslice <<
2248 GEN8_RPCS_EU_MAX_SHIFT;
2249 rpcs |= GEN8_RPCS_ENABLE;
2250 }
2251
2252 return rpcs;
2253}
2254
2255static int
2256populate_lr_context(struct intel_context *ctx, struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj,
2257 struct intel_engine_cs *ring, struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2258{
2259 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
2260 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2261 struct i915_hw_ppgtt *ppgtt = ctx->ppgtt;
2262 struct page *page;
2263 uint32_t *reg_state;
2264 int ret;
2265
2266 if (!ppgtt)
2267 ppgtt = dev_priv->mm.aliasing_ppgtt;
2268
2269 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_cpu_domain(ctx_obj, true);
2270 if (ret) {
2271 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Could not set to CPU domain\n");
2272 return ret;
2273 }
2274
2275 ret = i915_gem_object_get_pages(ctx_obj);
2276 if (ret) {
2277 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Could not get object pages\n");
2278 return ret;
2279 }
2280
2281 i915_gem_object_pin_pages(ctx_obj);
2282
2283 /* The second page of the context object contains some fields which must
2284 * be set up prior to the first execution. */
2285 page = i915_gem_object_get_page(ctx_obj, LRC_STATE_PN);
2286 reg_state = kmap_atomic(page);
2287
2288 /* A context is actually a big batch buffer with several MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM
2289 * commands followed by (reg, value) pairs. The values we are setting here are
2290 * only for the first context restore: on a subsequent save, the GPU will
2291 * recreate this batchbuffer with new values (including all the missing
2292 * MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM commands that we are not initializing here). */
2293 if (ring->id == RCS)
2294 reg_state[CTX_LRI_HEADER_0] = MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(14);
2295 else
2296 reg_state[CTX_LRI_HEADER_0] = MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(11);
2297 reg_state[CTX_LRI_HEADER_0] |= MI_LRI_FORCE_POSTED;
2298 reg_state[CTX_CONTEXT_CONTROL] = RING_CONTEXT_CONTROL(ring);
2299 reg_state[CTX_CONTEXT_CONTROL+1] =
2300 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(CTX_CTRL_INHIBIT_SYN_CTX_SWITCH |
2301 CTX_CTRL_ENGINE_CTX_RESTORE_INHIBIT |
2302 CTX_CTRL_RS_CTX_ENABLE);
2303 reg_state[CTX_RING_HEAD] = RING_HEAD(ring->mmio_base);
2304 reg_state[CTX_RING_HEAD+1] = 0;
2305 reg_state[CTX_RING_TAIL] = RING_TAIL(ring->mmio_base);
2306 reg_state[CTX_RING_TAIL+1] = 0;
2307 reg_state[CTX_RING_BUFFER_START] = RING_START(ring->mmio_base);
2308 /* Ring buffer start address is not known until the buffer is pinned.
2309 * It is written to the context image in execlists_update_context()
2310 */
2311 reg_state[CTX_RING_BUFFER_CONTROL] = RING_CTL(ring->mmio_base);
2312 reg_state[CTX_RING_BUFFER_CONTROL+1] =
2313 ((ringbuf->size - PAGE_SIZE) & RING_NR_PAGES) | RING_VALID;
2314 reg_state[CTX_BB_HEAD_U] = ring->mmio_base + 0x168;
2315 reg_state[CTX_BB_HEAD_U+1] = 0;
2316 reg_state[CTX_BB_HEAD_L] = ring->mmio_base + 0x140;
2317 reg_state[CTX_BB_HEAD_L+1] = 0;
2318 reg_state[CTX_BB_STATE] = ring->mmio_base + 0x110;
2319 reg_state[CTX_BB_STATE+1] = (1<<5);
2320 reg_state[CTX_SECOND_BB_HEAD_U] = ring->mmio_base + 0x11c;
2321 reg_state[CTX_SECOND_BB_HEAD_U+1] = 0;
2322 reg_state[CTX_SECOND_BB_HEAD_L] = ring->mmio_base + 0x114;
2323 reg_state[CTX_SECOND_BB_HEAD_L+1] = 0;
2324 reg_state[CTX_SECOND_BB_STATE] = ring->mmio_base + 0x118;
2325 reg_state[CTX_SECOND_BB_STATE+1] = 0;
2326 if (ring->id == RCS) {
2327 reg_state[CTX_BB_PER_CTX_PTR] = ring->mmio_base + 0x1c0;
2328 reg_state[CTX_BB_PER_CTX_PTR+1] = 0;
2329 reg_state[CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX] = ring->mmio_base + 0x1c4;
2330 reg_state[CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX+1] = 0;
2331 reg_state[CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX_OFFSET] = ring->mmio_base + 0x1c8;
2332 reg_state[CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX_OFFSET+1] = 0;
2333 if (ring->wa_ctx.obj) {
2334 struct i915_ctx_workarounds *wa_ctx = &ring->wa_ctx;
2335 uint32_t ggtt_offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(wa_ctx->obj);
2336
2337 reg_state[CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX+1] =
2338 (ggtt_offset + wa_ctx->indirect_ctx.offset * sizeof(uint32_t)) |
2339 (wa_ctx->indirect_ctx.size / CACHELINE_DWORDS);
2340
2341 reg_state[CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX_OFFSET+1] =
2342 CTX_RCS_INDIRECT_CTX_OFFSET_DEFAULT << 6;
2343
2344 reg_state[CTX_BB_PER_CTX_PTR+1] =
2345 (ggtt_offset + wa_ctx->per_ctx.offset * sizeof(uint32_t)) |
2346 0x01;
2347 }
2348 }
2349 reg_state[CTX_LRI_HEADER_1] = MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(9);
2350 reg_state[CTX_LRI_HEADER_1] |= MI_LRI_FORCE_POSTED;
2351 reg_state[CTX_CTX_TIMESTAMP] = ring->mmio_base + 0x3a8;
2352 reg_state[CTX_CTX_TIMESTAMP+1] = 0;
2353 reg_state[CTX_PDP3_UDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_UDW(ring, 3);
2354 reg_state[CTX_PDP3_LDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_LDW(ring, 3);
2355 reg_state[CTX_PDP2_UDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_UDW(ring, 2);
2356 reg_state[CTX_PDP2_LDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_LDW(ring, 2);
2357 reg_state[CTX_PDP1_UDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_UDW(ring, 1);
2358 reg_state[CTX_PDP1_LDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_LDW(ring, 1);
2359 reg_state[CTX_PDP0_UDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_UDW(ring, 0);
2360 reg_state[CTX_PDP0_LDW] = GEN8_RING_PDP_LDW(ring, 0);
2361
2362 if (USES_FULL_48BIT_PPGTT(ppgtt->base.dev)) {
2363 /* 64b PPGTT (48bit canonical)
2364 * PDP0_DESCRIPTOR contains the base address to PML4 and
2365 * other PDP Descriptors are ignored.
2366 */
2367 ASSIGN_CTX_PML4(ppgtt, reg_state);
2368 } else {
2369 /* 32b PPGTT
2370 * PDP*_DESCRIPTOR contains the base address of space supported.
2371 * With dynamic page allocation, PDPs may not be allocated at
2372 * this point. Point the unallocated PDPs to the scratch page
2373 */
2374 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 3);
2375 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 2);
2376 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 1);
2377 ASSIGN_CTX_PDP(ppgtt, reg_state, 0);
2378 }
2379
2380 if (ring->id == RCS) {
2381 reg_state[CTX_LRI_HEADER_2] = MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1);
2382 reg_state[CTX_R_PWR_CLK_STATE] = GEN8_R_PWR_CLK_STATE;
2383 reg_state[CTX_R_PWR_CLK_STATE+1] = make_rpcs(dev);
2384 }
2385
2386 kunmap_atomic(reg_state);
2387
2388 ctx_obj->dirty = 1;
2389 set_page_dirty(page);
2390 i915_gem_object_unpin_pages(ctx_obj);
2391
2392 return 0;
2393}
2394
2395/**
2396 * intel_lr_context_free() - free the LRC specific bits of a context
2397 * @ctx: the LR context to free.
2398 *
2399 * The real context freeing is done in i915_gem_context_free: this only
2400 * takes care of the bits that are LRC related: the per-engine backing
2401 * objects and the logical ringbuffer.
2402 */
2403void intel_lr_context_free(struct intel_context *ctx)
2404{
2405 int i;
2406
2407 for (i = 0; i < I915_NUM_RINGS; i++) {
2408 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj = ctx->engine[i].state;
2409
2410 if (ctx_obj) {
2411 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf =
2412 ctx->engine[i].ringbuf;
2413 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = ringbuf->ring;
2414
2415 if (ctx == ring->default_context) {
2416 intel_unpin_ringbuffer_obj(ringbuf);
2417 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ctx_obj);
2418 }
2419 WARN_ON(ctx->engine[ring->id].pin_count);
2420 intel_ringbuffer_free(ringbuf);
2421 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ctx_obj->base);
2422 }
2423 }
2424}
2425
2426static uint32_t get_lr_context_size(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2427{
2428 int ret = 0;
2429
2430 WARN_ON(INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen < 8);
2431
2432 switch (ring->id) {
2433 case RCS:
2434 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 9)
2435 ret = GEN9_LR_CONTEXT_RENDER_SIZE;
2436 else
2437 ret = GEN8_LR_CONTEXT_RENDER_SIZE;
2438 break;
2439 case VCS:
2440 case BCS:
2441 case VECS:
2442 case VCS2:
2443 ret = GEN8_LR_CONTEXT_OTHER_SIZE;
2444 break;
2445 }
2446
2447 return ret;
2448}
2449
2450static void lrc_setup_hardware_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
2451 struct drm_i915_gem_object *default_ctx_obj)
2452{
2453 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
2454 struct page *page;
2455
2456 /* The HWSP is part of the default context object in LRC mode. */
2457 ring->status_page.gfx_addr = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(default_ctx_obj)
2458 + LRC_PPHWSP_PN * PAGE_SIZE;
2459 page = i915_gem_object_get_page(default_ctx_obj, LRC_PPHWSP_PN);
2460 ring->status_page.page = page;
2461 ring->status_page.page_addr = kmap(page);
2462 ring->status_page.obj = default_ctx_obj;
2463
2464 I915_WRITE(RING_HWS_PGA(ring->mmio_base),
2465 (u32)ring->status_page.gfx_addr);
2466 POSTING_READ(RING_HWS_PGA(ring->mmio_base));
2467}
2468
2469/**
2470 * intel_lr_context_deferred_alloc() - create the LRC specific bits of a context
2471 * @ctx: LR context to create.
2472 * @ring: engine to be used with the context.
2473 *
2474 * This function can be called more than once, with different engines, if we plan
2475 * to use the context with them. The context backing objects and the ringbuffers
2476 * (specially the ringbuffer backing objects) suck a lot of memory up, and that's why
2477 * the creation is a deferred call: it's better to make sure first that we need to use
2478 * a given ring with the context.
2479 *
2480 * Return: non-zero on error.
2481 */
2482
2483int intel_lr_context_deferred_alloc(struct intel_context *ctx,
2484 struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2485{
2486 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
2487 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj;
2488 uint32_t context_size;
2489 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf;
2490 int ret;
2491
2492 WARN_ON(ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state != NULL);
2493 WARN_ON(ctx->engine[ring->id].state);
2494
2495 context_size = round_up(get_lr_context_size(ring), 4096);
2496
2497 /* One extra page as the sharing data between driver and GuC */
2498 context_size += PAGE_SIZE * LRC_PPHWSP_PN;
2499
2500 ctx_obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, context_size);
2501 if (!ctx_obj) {
2502 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Alloc LRC backing obj failed.\n");
2503 return -ENOMEM;
2504 }
2505
2506 ringbuf = intel_engine_create_ringbuffer(ring, 4 * PAGE_SIZE);
2507 if (IS_ERR(ringbuf)) {
2508 ret = PTR_ERR(ringbuf);
2509 goto error_deref_obj;
2510 }
2511
2512 ret = populate_lr_context(ctx, ctx_obj, ring, ringbuf);
2513 if (ret) {
2514 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Failed to populate LRC: %d\n", ret);
2515 goto error_ringbuf;
2516 }
2517
2518 ctx->engine[ring->id].ringbuf = ringbuf;
2519 ctx->engine[ring->id].state = ctx_obj;
2520
2521 if (ctx != ring->default_context && ring->init_context) {
2522 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req;
2523
2524 ret = i915_gem_request_alloc(ring,
2525 ctx, &req);
2526 if (ret) {
2527 DRM_ERROR("ring create req: %d\n",
2528 ret);
2529 goto error_ringbuf;
2530 }
2531
2532 ret = ring->init_context(req);
2533 if (ret) {
2534 DRM_ERROR("ring init context: %d\n",
2535 ret);
2536 i915_gem_request_cancel(req);
2537 goto error_ringbuf;
2538 }
2539 i915_add_request_no_flush(req);
2540 }
2541 return 0;
2542
2543error_ringbuf:
2544 intel_ringbuffer_free(ringbuf);
2545error_deref_obj:
2546 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ctx_obj->base);
2547 ctx->engine[ring->id].ringbuf = NULL;
2548 ctx->engine[ring->id].state = NULL;
2549 return ret;
2550}
2551
2552void intel_lr_context_reset(struct drm_device *dev,
2553 struct intel_context *ctx)
2554{
2555 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2556 struct intel_engine_cs *ring;
2557 int i;
2558
2559 for_each_ring(ring, dev_priv, i) {
2560 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj =
2561 ctx->engine[ring->id].state;
2562 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf =
2563 ctx->engine[ring->id].ringbuf;
2564 uint32_t *reg_state;
2565 struct page *page;
2566
2567 if (!ctx_obj)
2568 continue;
2569
2570 if (i915_gem_object_get_pages(ctx_obj)) {
2571 WARN(1, "Failed get_pages for context obj\n");
2572 continue;
2573 }
2574 page = i915_gem_object_get_page(ctx_obj, LRC_STATE_PN);
2575 reg_state = kmap_atomic(page);
2576
2577 reg_state[CTX_RING_HEAD+1] = 0;
2578 reg_state[CTX_RING_TAIL+1] = 0;
2579
2580 kunmap_atomic(reg_state);
2581
2582 ringbuf->head = 0;
2583 ringbuf->tail = 0;
2584 }
2585}
